oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Broadband gap-coupled circular microstrip antennas
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DATTA, M
KUMAR, G
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: edges
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Several planar broadband gap-coupled circular microstrip antenna (MSA) configurations have been proposed. Only a single circular patch is fed, and a number of parasitic circular patches are gap-coupled, which results in increase in both bandwidth and gain of the antenna. These antennas have been analyzed using Method of Moment based software.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: IEEE ANTENNAS AND PROPAGATION SOCIETY INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM, VOLS 1-4: TRANSMITTING WAVES OF PROGRESS TO THE NEXT MILLENNIUM,1418-1421
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 2000 IEEE Antennas-and-Propagation-Society International Symposium,SALT LAKE CITY, UT,JUL 16-21, 2000
